intro: Fagara caudata, commonly known as the clustered sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Fagara caudata is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
